topic.title: Why are file updates fail?
topic.body:
There are so many "file update failed" messages. 
What causes them? What can be done to prevent them and/or fix them?

2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:
> [redrobinhood](#comment_1_1MxejC3wJ1PB6QbLwL7g3HzC4ZPojJogD3): Hi i want to know if i can use zeronet email to send email on other servers like yahoo etc??

No. 
As far as, I understand it is a messaging system of ZeroNet based on an entirely different protocol than usual emails.

MarkDown Test
===
based on the [MarkDown](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:markdown) page of [ZeroWiki](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:home)

with *-s
---

1. *italic*
2. **bold**
3. ***both***
5. `code` 
---
### with _-s and +-s

+ _italic_
+ __bold__
+ ___both___

1_12xXVxkjN2oM6hwtzaSSJxAaiT7VW51VHQ.body:
If security and privacy is top priority for you, I recommend [Conversation](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdfilter=conversation&fdid=eu.siacs.conversations). It is also listed as a recommended alternative of whatsapp on [prism-break.org](https://prism-break.org/en/all/#instant-messaging).

[Telegram](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdfilter=telegram&fdid=org.telegram.messenger) is a good and easy-to-use alternative, but its servers run proprietary software...

1_1EnWNsQYovZrxBjDiDHtP1TT7BsJ1Dd6md.body:
In theory, it can live forever. 

That how long it _will_ is a different question. 
That only depends on us. It will live while there is at least one peer.

1_1M4Q5nX7hVdm46GdfiCSLaKG2NuY52tcLy.body:
> [ks](#comment_111_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): Interesting. How come the number for 0chan on my node is lower?

I don't know the explanation, but I think it is normal. I run ZeroNet on two computes and they see significantly different number of peers. On the one I use (way) more often the number of visible peers are 2 or 3 times higher.

1_1FkHAWYYdURFGyXt3cZTs3neGVYumEpjsF.body:
> [xivap](#comment_1_1EtRNxxZF7PdRNU5ka1yiAbAL9mbzKWnaE): 0chan is certainly the most attractive, but it might use some redesign (I don't mean it in the HTML5 sense, just that users should be able to create a threads on their own, and reply slightly quicker). 
> ..But then, how will people take care of the spammers? This is puzzling.

Yes, it still has plenty of flaws :-(  
but currently it is one of the best Zites on ZeroNet. 
It's a pity that currently there is no real competition for being one of the best Zites here.
